New Records: Adam Zampa became just the third Australian spinner to take four wickets in a World Cup clash, following Shane Warne (four times) and Brad Hogg (twice).
Key Match Events: Adam Zampa took four wickets against Sri Lanka while battling back spasms, earning him player of the match honours.
Australia won the match by five wickets, with Marcus Stoinis hitting the winning runs with a massive six over long on.
Josh Inglis scored 58 runs before being dismissed.
Glenn Maxwell scored 28 off just 14 balls in a spectacular display of batting.
Marnus Labuschagne was dismissed by Madushanka after a short ball.
Josh Inglis brought up his first World Cup 50 with a beautiful straight drive down the ground for four.
Mitch Marsh was run out for a run-a-ball 52 after a disastrous run out.
Post-Match Reflections: Adam Zampa reflected on his performance, stating that he felt he could have bowled better and that his role is to take wickets to make it easier for the death bowlers.
Zampa mentioned that the call to take him off for Maxwell was made by Pat Cummins, but he might have made it himself due to his sore back.
